trustfund:
TF037132-ARGENTINA - FLOODPLAIN
            MANAGEMENT WORKSHOP,TF037914-ARGENTINA - FLOOD PROTECTION

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the flood protection project
            for Argentina were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory,
            the risk to development outcome was moderate, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project: Sharing
            the costs and obligations is a sound principle and will
            likely promote efficiency and sustainability. Decision
            making authority should be aligned with ability for
            influencing project progress. Complex works such as flood
            protection construction requires flexible systems for timely
            implementation. Effective flood protection requires
            basin-wide action. The self-built houses offer more proof
            that sharing the costs and obligations will promote
            ownership, efficiency, and sustainability.
